# Describe

## Descriptive methods

Summarize the data to understand its characteristics.

::: {.incremental}
- Central Tendency: What is the "typical" value?
- Dispersion: How much do the values vary?
- Distribution: What does the data look like?
- Association: How do variables relate to one another?
:::

## Central Tendency

A single statistic that aims to represent a variable.

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="30%"}
Mode

```{r}
#| label: mode
#| echo: false

set.seed(123)

x <- rgamma(10000, shape = 2, scale = 1)

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot", lwd = 3)

mode <- x[which.max(table(x))]

abline(v = mode, col = "red", lwd = 3)
```

Most common\
`r round(mode, 2)`\
[*used most for categorical data*]{style="font-size: .5em"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
Mean

```{r}
#| label: mean
#| echo: false

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot", lwd = 3)

mean <- mean(x)

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
```

Average\
`r round(mean, 2)`
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
Median

```{r}
#| label: median
#| echo: false

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot", lwd = 3)

median <- median(x)

abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)
```

Middle\
`r round(median, 2)`
:::
::::

## Dispersion

A single statistic to represent the variability of a variable.

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
Standard Deviation

```{r}
#| label: sd
#| echo: false

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot", lwd = 3)

sd <- sd(x)
mean <- mean(x)

abline(v = mean(x) + c(-1, 1) * sd, col = "green", lwd = 3, lty = 2)
abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
```

`r round(sd, 2)` around the mean
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
IQR (Interquartile Range)

```{r}
#| label: iqr
#| echo: false

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot", lwd = 3)

q1 <- quantile(x, 0.25)
q2 <- median(x)
q3 <- quantile(x, 0.75)

abline(v = c(q1, q3), col = "blue", lwd = 3, lty = 2)
abline(v = q2, col = "blue", lwd = 3)
```

`r round(q3 - q1, 2)` 75$^{th}$ - 25$^{th}$ percentiles
:::
::::

## Distribution

[Normal distribution]{style="font-size: .75em"}
```{r}
#| label: normal-distribution
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 5
#| layout-ncol: 3
#| cache: true

set.seed(123)

x <- rnorm(10000000, mean = 0, sd = 1)

# add mode, mean, and median

mean <- mean(x)
median <- median(x)

hist(x, main = "Histogram")

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot")

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)

boxplot(x, horizontal = TRUE)

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)
```
[Skewed distributions]{style="font-size: .75em"}

```{r}
#| label: skewed-distribution
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 5
#| layout-ncol: 3

set.seed(123)

x <- rgamma(10000, shape = 2, scale = 1)

# add mode, mean, and median
mode <- x[which.max(table(x))]
mean <- mean(x)
median <- median(x)

hist(x, main = "Histogram")

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)

plot(density(x), main = "Density Plot")

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)

boxplot(x, horizontal = TRUE)

abline(v = mean, col = "green", lwd = 3)
abline(v = median, col = "blue", lwd = 3)
```
